cards.title: Football / Tottenham Hotspur to host NFL games at new stadium
cards.rawTitle: Tottenham Hotspur to host NFL games at new stadium

item.title: Tottenham Hotspur to host NFL games at new stadium
item.trailText: Tottenham Hotspur announce on Wednesday that they have agreed to a 10-year deal with the NFL to stage at least two games a year
item.standFirst: Tottenham Hotspur announce on Wednesday that they have agreed to a 10-year deal with the NFL to stage at least two games a year. The new stadium, which will hold 61,000 spectators, will have an artificial surface for NFL games installed under the regular grass pitch which will be used by Spurs

cards.title: Extreme sports / Base jumper's wingsuit flight through the Swiss Alps
cards.rawTitle: Base jumper's wingsuit flight through the Swiss Alps

item.title: Base jumper's 'impossible' wingsuit flight through rock crevice in Swiss Alps
item.trailText: Italian base jumper Uli Emanuele has taken on what is thought to be one of the most technically challenging Base jumps ever executed
item.standFirst: Italian base jumper Uli Emanuele has taken on what is thought to be one of the most technically challenging Base jumps ever executed. Emanuele flies through a rock crevice near Lauterbrunnen in the Swiss Alps while filming the whole event in a promotional video for the GoPro camera company. On his Facebook page, Emanuele said he had trained three years for the jump and hiked 45 hours to get to the launch spot

stillImage.caption: Uli Emnuele glides through a fissure in a rockface in the Swiss Alps Photograph: GoPro Photograph: GoPro
stillImage.cleanCaption: Uli Emnuele glides through a fissure in a rockface in the Swiss Alps Photograph: GoPro

cards.title: Football / Gerrard a great addition to LA Galaxy, says Keane
cards.rawTitle: Gerrard a great addition to LA Galaxy, says Keane

item.title: Steven Gerrard a great addition to LA Galaxy, says Robbie Keane
item.trailText: LA Galaxy captain Robbie Keane says Steven Gerrard will be an important player for the American club. He makes his debut on Sunday
item.standFirst: LA Galaxy captain Robbie Keane says Steven Gerrard will be an important player for the American club – he makes his debut on Sunday. Keane, who was team-mates with Gerrard at Liverpool, says Gerrard is aware of the work he is required to put in but expects the midfielder to do well

cards.title: Wimbledon / Tom Jenkins' best images from day eight
cards.rawTitle: Tom Jenkins' best images from day eight

item.title: Wimbledon 2015: day eight
item.trailText: Guardian photographer Tom Jenkins brings you his best images from today’s play at SW19 with Novak Djokovic, Serena Williams and Maria Sharapova all in action
item.standFirst: Guardian photographer Tom Jenkins brings you his best images from today’s play at SW19 with Novak Djokovic, Serena Williams and Maria Sharapova all in action

displayImages.caption: Novak Djokovic of Serbia hits a return against Kevin Anderson of South Africa. The two players resumed this afternoon after being suspended at two sets all on Monday evening.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Novak Djokovic of Serbia hits a return against Kevin Anderson of South Africa. The two players resumed this afternoon after being suspended at two sets all on Monday evening.

displayImages.caption: Dark clouds build over No1 court, as the rain prepares to make an unwelcome return to SW19.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Dark clouds build over No1 court, as the rain prepares to make an unwelcome return to SW19.

displayImages.caption: The covers are prepared...
displayImages.cleanCaption: The covers are prepared...

displayImages.caption: ...and rain stops play before a ball is struck.
displayImages.cleanCaption: ...and rain stops play before a ball is struck.

displayImages.caption: Djokovic looks to the skies as the umbrellas go up.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Djokovic looks to the skies as the umbrellas go up.

displayImages.caption: When play did get underway, Djokovic clinched the deciding set 7-5 to reach the quarter-finals.
displayImages.cleanCaption: When play did get underway, Djokovic clinched the deciding set 7-5 to reach the quarter-finals.

displayImages.caption: Djokovic, who fought back from two sets down to fo through, will play US Open champion Marin Cilic in the quarter-finals.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Djokovic, who fought back from two sets down to fo through, will play US Open champion Marin Cilic in the quarter-finals.

displayImages.caption: Djokovic acknowledges the crowd after beating Anderson 6-7, 6-7, 6-1, 6-4, 6-4.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Djokovic acknowledges the crowd after beating Anderson 6-7, 6-7, 6-1, 6-4, 6-4.

displayImages.caption: Djokovic is congratulated by the South African No14 seed, who can reflect on a solid grass court season after also reaching the Queen’s Club final.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Djokovic is congratulated by the South African No14 seed, who can reflect on a solid grass court season after also reaching the Queen’s Club final.

displayImages.caption: Great Britain’s Anna Brogan plays a backhand in her girls’ singles match against Katarina Zavatska. Brogan won the second round match 6-1, 6-3.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Great Britain’s Anna Brogan plays a backhand in her girls’ singles match against Katarina Zavatska. Brogan won the second round match 6-1, 6-3.

displayImages.caption: Tuesday was women’s quarter-final day – here we see Maria Sharapova in action against Coco Vandeweghe of the USA.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Tuesday was women’s quarter-final day – here we see Maria Sharapova in action against Coco Vandeweghe of the USA.

displayImages.caption: Sharapova unleashes a double backhand return on her way to taking the first set 6-3.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sharapova unleashes a double backhand return on her way to taking the first set 6-3.

displayImages.caption: Sharapova stretches for a forehand as she digs in for a 6-3, 6-7, 6-2 win over world No47 Vandeweghe.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sharapova stretches for a forehand as she digs in for a 6-3, 6-7, 6-2 win over world No47 Vandeweghe.

displayImages.caption: Sharapova celebrates her three-set victory – but will she be facing old foe Serena Williams in the semi-finals?
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sharapova celebrates her three-set victory – but will she be facing old foe Serena Williams in the semi-finals?

displayImages.caption: Serena Williams serves in her match with Victoria Azarenka on Centre Court
displayImages.cleanCaption: Serena Williams serves in her match with Victoria Azarenka on Centre Court

displayImages.caption: Azarenka has slipped down the world rankings, but the No23 seed comes out swinging, and takes the first set 6-3
displayImages.cleanCaption: Azarenka has slipped down the world rankings, but the No23 seed comes out swinging, and takes the first set 6-3

displayImages.caption: Williams returns with a double forehand as she tries to fight her way back into the match.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Williams returns with a double forehand as she tries to fight her way back into the match.

displayImages.caption: Azarenka cannot keep her strong start going, and Williams takes the second set 6-2.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Azarenka cannot keep her strong start going, and Williams takes the second set 6-2.

displayImages.caption: Perfect timing as we see the ball flat against Williams’ racket, a split second before another forehand is unleashed.
displayImages.altText: The ball is compressed flat as Williams returns
displayImages.cleanCaption: Perfect timing as we see the ball flat against Williams’ racket, a split second before another forehand is unleashed.

displayImages.caption: Azarenka enjoys herself out on Centre Court as the match goes to a decider.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Azarenka enjoys herself out on Centre Court as the match goes to a decider.

displayImages.caption: Williams proved too strong for her Belarusian opponent, winning through 3-6, 6-2, 6-3.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Williams proved too strong for her Belarusian opponent, winning through 3-6, 6-2, 6-3.

displayImages.caption: Serena Williams celebrates another hard-fought Centre Court victory. She will now play Maria Sharapova in the last four, with Agniesza Radwanska and Garbine Muguruza meeting in the second semi-final.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Serena Williams celebrates another hard-fought Centre Court victory. She will now play Maria Sharapova in the last four, with Agniesza Radwanska and Garbine Muguruza meeting in the second semi-final.

cards.title: Women's World Cup / USA given big LA welcome after triumph
cards.rawTitle: USA given big LA welcome after triumph

item.title: US team gets big LA welcome after Women's World Cup victory
item.trailText: The US football team arrives in Los Angeles to the ecstasy of fans after winning the Women's World Cup
item.standFirst: The US football team arrives in Los Angeles to the ecstasy of fans after winning the Women's World Cup. The Americans defeated Japan 5-2 to claim the title and are the only nation to have won the Women's World Cup three times. New York City will hold a parade on Friday

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for US team receive heroes welcome in LA after Womens World Cup victory - video Photograph: guardian.co.uk

cards.title: Football / Gerrard delighted to follow Donovan and Beckham to LA Galaxy
cards.rawTitle: Gerrard delighted to follow Donovan and Beckham to LA Galaxy

item.title: Steven Gerrard praises Landon Donovan at LA Galaxy intro
item.trailText: Steven Gerrard says he is excited to be following in the footsteps of David Beckham and Landon Donovan after being formally introduced as an LA Galaxy player on Tuesday
item.standFirst: Steven Gerrard says he is excited to be following in the footsteps of David Beckham and Landon Donovan after being formally introduced as an LA Galaxy player on Tuesday. The former Liverpool captain praises Donovan, saying he is a legend and a hero. Gerrard's first game for the American team will be on 11 July

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Landon Donovan is a hero of mine, says Steven Gerrard after LA Galaxy introduction - video Photograph: guardian.co.uk

cards.title: Football / Lampard excited about New York City debut
cards.rawTitle: Lampard excited about New York City debut

item.title: Frank Lampard excited about his New York City FC debut
item.trailText: Frank Lampard says he is focused on playing his best and winning, before his debut for New York City FC on Sunday
item.standFirst: Frank Lampard says he is focused on playing his best and winning, before his debut for New York City FC on Sunday. Lampard signed with the American team last year but was kept by Manchester City until the end of the Premier League season. Lampard says there is greater unpredictability in the American league
